One Friday night fully clad for bed I got the worst sweet attack and found this recipe. This is like 'manna from heaven'. So darn easy and ingredients almost any kitchen would have readily available. I did have some toffee chips I threw in and some pecans, and 'boy howdy', did they fill the bill! I burned the roof of my mouth, I couldn't wait to test them out, really great. Thanks, Angie

This are some of the best brownies ive ever made! i was worried at first because of the small amounts of flour but it turned out great! i doubled the recipe and didnt make the frosting but put betty crocker's vanilla frosting on it and a few chocolate shavings. I took it to a party and it was a HIT!!!! Thanx Angie!!!!!
SOOOOO Good ! Excellent and easy, just what I was looking for. I did increase the cocoa to 1/2, because I had read a lot of the reviews. They turned out great. Thanks Angie
Not very fudgy at all. Okay, but the boxed version is beeter!
These were great - never been able to make successful brownies before but they were delicious despite that I did overcook the base a little. Lovely and chewy!
These were Yummy! They didn't last very long everyone thought it was more like fudge then brownies but still delicious.

In the past I have tried recipes that have been reviewed as being the best, and being disappointed in the results. Let me just say, these are the BEST brownies, not just because they taste wonderful...but they are made without anything fancy! My whole family loved them, even my non-chocolate loving daughter, who said that she wished she had more than two thumbs - because they were that yummy! See...600+ reviews, couldn't be too wrong!

Like most of the other reviews I found this recipe to be very easy to make and overall very tasty. I did not make the frosting because I thought it would be too sweet. I also added almonds to the mixture and it came out just great. What I like most of all was that the ingredients used were simple and I had it all available in my kitchen.
Not a big fan of powdered cocoa. Will not be making these again. They did not taste as good as package mixes.
Very very chocolatey and delicous.
Wonderful brownies. :) Had a hard time staying away from them.
5* PLUS! These brownies are aptly named! I added some chocolate chips, this was chocolate heaven!!!!
I couldn't get the frosting to come out but the brownies were good.

Tried these last night and the family said they were better than the last home made batch. However I like my brownies to be less cakey. I like good old fudge brownies like the box mix. I will make these again if I can't find a fudge recipe.
Absolutely Fantastic!! And easy to make!
These brownies are absolutely delicious. Very moist and the frosting is awesome too. This is the only recipe I will use for brownies from now on.
These brownies are the best. I topped mine with chocolate chips and walnuts. They are so rich!
Wow- absolutely delicious! I used margarine and skipped the frosting, and they were still incredibly good.
Absolutely the best tasting and easiest to make brownies that you'll find on this web site!
Very fudgy, better than any bakery!
this recipe was pretty good, although the mixture didn't stay together very well.
These were just great! My whole family loved them. I added about a tablepoon of milk to the frosting so it was a little creamier. I'll never use a box mix again!
These were great. My brothers and father ate them in a day and a half. If making these for the first time, mix all the ingredients in the same pot/pan the butter was melted in.
I made various members of my family give me a star rating for these brownies, and everyone agreed they were a five! They're a great basic brownie--imagine the add-in possibilities!!
I though to myself they are brownies how good can they be. THEY ARE GREAT!. Very chocolatey without being to sweet. Will make many times.

These brownies were okay, but I'm not convinced they are the best. The icing was really a pain to make and disappointing. I also had to add some milk to get the correct consistency. The kids loved them, but I don't know if the pain of making these is worth my time over the boxed kind.

Very dense and fudgy. The frosting was sweet without being cloying. I like the honey in the frosting. I had to add a little milk to the frosting to get it to the correct consistency. Overall, good brownie.
Delicious! I'll definitely make these again. They were nice and gooey.

I made this for my last birthday instead of a birthday cake - I made 2 batches of double the mixture as separate slabs, sandwiched them with cookies and cream ice cream in the middle and then topped with hot fudge sauce (store-bought) - and voila - instant birthday cake!! Even with 64 servings and only 25 people, it disappeared in about 5 minutes!
These are the easiest best tasting brownies that I have ever made. My family loves them and they are requested for special family get togethers.
Wow these brownies are good! I've made them every time I run out ever since I got the recipe. I never think the icing is going to work, but it always does.
Truly the best brownies ever. They ALWAYS turn out, I make them at least once a week and they're gone before they cool down.
Without a doubt, this is the BEST brownies recipe I've ever made. It's impossible to muck these up, so they turn out beautiful EVERY SINGLE TIME! Fantastic
Super easy to make and taste great (especially the first day) The frosting was thick to spread but sure tasted good.
Thanks for a great recipe!!
My family and I really enjoyed these! Chewy and VERY Chocolatey!! I found we had to cook them longer than the suggested time... 60 mins, but then again, our stove is quite old.
I'm not a big fan of brownies, but these are great! Very moist, and I had no problem with the icing turning out perfectly with ingredients as stated. I'll definitely make these again.
The best bowl-lickin' brownies this side of the Missippi!!!They were a kick at our ward prayer!!!
Very good!
They were ok. I wasn't impressed.
Others liked them, but thought they were a bit too rich. I don't think I'll make them again.
These really are the best! Very moist. Stayed moist for the few days that they lasted.

FANTASTIC! People raved about these at a recent baby shower. NO more boxed mixes for me! I did need to add a tablespoon of milk to the icing to make it spreadable, but that was my only modification besides doubling the recipe. Thanks for a real winner!

mine turned out like chocolate cake, too! it was not moist and chewy as i hoped it would be. and i wonder what i did wrong because it didnt slice too well. nonetheless, everybody liked it! i might tweak this recipe a little to find my desired consistency. thanks for this recipe, too!
yum yum... i put small 'dallops' of frosting all over the brownies as soon as they came out of the oven and spreaded it a couple minutes later, after it melted a bit
Yum!!
These are the greatest brownies!! Really easy to make and soooo good.
Great Recipe....Fairly Easy. Extremely Chocolatey and Rich.
My only complaint is this doesn't make nearly enough.These will be gone almost as soon as you make them. Thanks for sharing.

One of my older brothers loves brownies ... he helped us out on the farm one day ... so I thought I'd make him a batch. But I wanted something new ... and WOW ... what can I say ... he didn't believe me that I actually made these ones! The were awesome ... better double it though ... they go real fast!

Mmmm... these were yummy! I was very skeptical during the whole process, but they turned out great! I did have to add milk to the frosting, because it wasn't smooth at all with the ingredients listed. Very good & definitely a keeper!

Maybe I did something wrong, these were okay, not great. I prefer Hershey's quick and easy brownies. They were eaten up so they couldn't have been bad. Just not my favorite. I thought they seemed stale on the first day.
These brownies were nothing less than great!

This is a great brownie recipe, not to sweet and all the ing. are allready in the house. Defent. the best ive made so far. i didnt use the frosting but sounds good, chewy and moist. A++++++++++++++++++++
This is the best recipe. EASY and GOOD, I will make these again and again. Never buy a box mix when you can make these delcious brownies. Thanks

I have tried many a brownie recipe and they always are too dry or too chewey or not chocolatey enough. These are amazing. My husband said that these were the best brownies that I had ever made and they were so quick and easy. I always have these ingredients on hand, so I know I will make them again. THANKS
WONDERFUL wont use the box again!!

These are the BEST brownies ever..just like the title..so ooey & gooey. A huge hit for my family. I just used choc. chips over top right when they came out of oven since I didn't have confectioner's sugar. I probably will never buy boxed again!! THANKS!!
I've always made brownies from a box foolishly believing them to be easier to prepare. These were simple, quick, and tasted fabulous
Thes brownies are the best! They always turn out and are great for summer parties and kids!
There's nothing else to say besides these brownies are the best!
My daughter Emilee made these, she is 10. These are better than a box! Very yummy !!! She will definalty be making them again!
This was a VERY good recipe that I've used over and over...thanks much :)
Theses are absolutely outstanding. Thank you Angie!

Some friends and I made these late one night while we were all having a chocolate craving. They turned out so good! But we didnt have any honey for the topping so instead we used chocolate and caramel syrup mixed in with the rest of the topping recipe. We loved them, and they were gone by morning! thanks

REALLY GOOD! I scaled the recipie for 36 servings and made them in a 9x13 pan and it worked perfectly. Unlike some of the previous reviewers, I did make the icing.....delicious! It is very rich with the icing though, so dont make it if you aren't absolutely crazy about chocolate. I will try it next time without the frosting just to eat these yummy brownies in their pure state. To everyone that added milk to the frosting.....this is not necessary if you frost the brownies immediately after taking them out of the oven. The very thick mixture melts into a wonderful spreading consistency. Great recipie!
very easy to make and delicious! even without the frosting, which I forgot to make.

YUM! Melts in your mouth! The crumbly topping is the big seller here. We've used it on our packaged brownies too.(cakes & cookies maybe too?) Just make sure the brownie is cooled off enough to be luke warm. Otherwise the topping will clump and not spread evenly.

All I can say is WOW! I've been searching for an excellent, fudgy, moist but not too moist brownie with excellent flavor for some time now and have finally found it! Delicious! We added chocolate chips to the top before baking, rather than the icing and they're wonderfuL!
Real good flavor but thin and chewy - fudgy. My preference is cakelike. Frosting is great and easy, I'll keep using it on cupcakes. Thanks, Pam

These brownies turned out excellent! I doubled the recipe with no problem. I had an extra tub of Milk Choc. Whipped Frosting (I think it was Duncan Hines) and spread only about a third of it while the brownies were still warm. I used an airbake pan lined with parchment and also lowered the temp to 325, baking for 30+ min (inserting a cake tester to test for doneness) if that helps anyone who had trouble with gooeyness.
I made these for my cousin's engagement party & they were a hit! I will definitely make these again!

The brownies were excelent, great for my sweet tooth. The only problem is that my icing did not come out right. It was too dry and was extremely clumpy. I will use the brownie recipie again but a different icing recipe.

This came out great when I made it the first time exactly per the recipe. The second time I doubled the quantity and it was a bit sweet. I guess some adjustments have to be made when doubling the quantity, which I have to figure out.
GREAT! Took them to a BBQ and everyone loved them. Thanks
I needed a quick dessert for unexpected dinner guests and this was perfect! Easy, quick, and delicious!!!
So FAST to make. I immediately decided to make a second batch to bring to work. A 'rich' brownie...I only had half fo one.
Yummy, rich, and so easy I will never use a mix again. Thank you
GReat brownies! And so fast to make..!
very good a keeper

I have made these twice now and it's true 'these always turn out'. Who knew you could make brownies without a box mix. These are so good that the second time I made them I doubled the recipe because there just weren't enough to go around the first time. Thank you for this recipe.
I didn't make the frosting b/c I thought it might be 'too much'. I also put a dash of instant espresso which was nice and subtle. I will definitely make this one again!

These are incredible! I've never made brownies from scratch before, and this recipe was incredibly easy. I even made them in my toaster oven using a Pampered Chef Mini Bar Pan. They're fantastic. I'll never use a boxed mix again! Thanks for a great recipe Angie!
Wonderful homemade brownies!!!
I love theme all my friends loved theme to !!!!!

Very good! I doubled this recipe, and it still turned out great. I also used caramel instead of honey in the icing-just because it sounded good...and it was. Try this recipe..you won't  be disappointed. Thanks Angie!
I am always skeptical when I see/hear 'The Best...' and was expecting to fail at making them, but they turned out to be the best I've ever made & had. I will never buy brownie mix again.
This was the first brownies I've ever made, and I think it is one of the best I'll ever find! Thank you.

I have been using this exact recipe for years (just modified to fit a smaller pan) but I had never frosted it before. The combination makes 'The Best Brownie' hands down. I'll never make another Brownie recipe again.
We all enjoyed them and they were very easy to make.
Call me crazy, but these just aren't the best brownies I've ever had. Sorry.
This is the best brownie recipe I have ever used! Brownies were perfect! This will be a frequently used recipe for me.

I'm amazed! I generally hate chocolate-y things but these were so yummy. *Make sure you let the brownies cool first before removing them from the pan. I made that mistake the first time I made these! (No worries though...my boyfriend just said 'Oh...guess I'll just have to eat them!!!')
I didn't even take the time to add the frosting and this was awesome!!!!

Okay, this was the 1st time that I tried making brownies from scratch. I was so glad that they turned out great. My hunnie never eats brownies but he ate these ones. He told me that he couldn't help it because they taste so great. The whole house loved them. I added chocolate chips in them to make it even more chocolatey. -yummy!. Thanks Angie.
These are fabulous!! I can't believe how easy this recipe was. I made this for company, for the first time, and they couldn't believe these were homemade. A keeper in my files!!!!
delicious, almost doubled it for a 9 x 13 pan and worked just great
These brownies were absolutely delicious. Easy to make and had my hubby saying 'more, more, more'. Great recipe, will definately make again.
These brownies are great! I didn't use the frosting because I thought that would be too much. I doubled the recipe and added a cup of chocolate chips. They are a big hit with my family.

These really are the best brownies! I love to bake, but I haven't found a brownie recipe that my husband prefers over the boxed kind until now. Plus, they are really quick and easy to prepare. The only thing I had to change was to add a tablespoon of milk to the frosting - otherwise I just had a sticky powder. This is definitely a recipe I'm keeping on hand!
Wow - the ratings don't lie. These are amazing. It really is a perfect brownie. Only thing I changed: blended 2 Tbsp milk with frosting (to make it creamier) before frosting the brownies.
Brilliant!!!!!!
Yum! They were gone in five minutes at the party! EVERYONE loved them!

These brownies were very good, although I did add some chocolate chips and some nuts. I ended up having to bake at least 10 minutes longer than stated in recipe, but that could just be my oven. I will be making these again for sure.

Awesome! I made these for a bake sale at my daughter's school and turned out excellent, very moist. Next time I will add some pecans or walnuts. This recipe will definitely stay in my recipe box. Thanks for sharing!!

Very quick and easy. The brownies turned out chewy and moist. I added a little bit of milk to the frosting until it was of easy spreading consistency and then spread it on the brownies about 10 minutes after taking them out. They turned out perfect! Everyone loved them!

I was looking for a recipe that would replace one that I accidentally threw out in a recent cleaning frenzy. This one is good but I like brownies that are more chocolatey (sp?) than these. These are a bit too sweet for me also.
I made these last night while preparing dinner. These are the best brownies ever!!! I won't make box brownies ever again.
Really yummy and easy! Served them at a small dinner party, and a few people had brought pastries from a gourmet pastry shop, and these were still everyone's favorite
I have made these 2 times, and they are the best!
These brownies are soooooooo good. I absolutely love them. Instead of honey, I used a little bit of corn syrup in the frosting.
Tastes great!
It kinda gets alittle spongy like a cake, but it's still good!!
Se las he hecho a mi marido y le han gustado mucho. Eskerrik asko!
My sister made these for a recent family event. They were fabulous, not too cakey at all, and my little nieces and nephew loved them. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
Too cakey for me... but they were good
Excellent! Everyone who tries these brownies, loves them! The frosting is delicious, but a bit difficult to work with. You definitely want to frost the brownies while they are still quite warm.

These brownies really do always turn out! I've used this recipe more than once and I always get lots of compliments. They are moist, delicious, and around my family they are usually consumed in less then 15 minutes.
these brownies are great! the second time i made them i added some peanut butter, and they were still excellent!
I added dark chocolate chips and walnuts and sprinkled with just confectioners sugar. They were great. Next time i will bake them with mint chips instead of chocolate chips!
Lucsious...much better than from the box...and with ingredients I always have on hand!
This recipe is great. I doubled the recipe for a family gathering and it still came out perfect. This is the best brownie yet.
these were ok, a bit on the fudgy side. easy to make, but the frosting was a little heavy. my family liked them, maybe next time i'll make them w/o the frosting....
They were good, but a little too sweet, and it seemed like they were shallower and more rich than i'm used too--maybe I didn't do it right? I like the use of honey though. :)
The BOMB of the Brownie world! Unbelievably good...and they seem to come out a little different every time I make them.
These brownies are great. For a faster frosting, just sprinkle the confectioners sugar after brownies have cooled. Yum.

I thought these brownies were very good. After reading all the problems with the icing I didn't even bother with it; instead I looked up chocolate frosting (at All Recipes of course) and found a really great icing. Thanks

Really easy and so fudgy! I loved them, and will make them many more times in the future! The only complaint I had is that my frosting did not spread as easily as I would have liked... but the taste makes up for it!
Excellent brownies! I will be making this often. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

These brownies taste wonderful! I made a batch to send to my cousin, but my husband tried his best to get me to let him have them instead. The brownies are moist and flavorful, but they are really thin...I think I may have used a 9' square pan instead of an 8' one. At any rate, this recipe is definitely a keeper.

Mmm.. yummy! I made this recipe on the spur of the moment. Had all the ingredients on hand. Very quick and easy to make. Added about 1 TBSP of milk to the frosting to thin it. Was powdery without it. Definately try this recipe!!
My 13 year old daughter made this recipe by herself. It was fun, easy and delicious.
This brownies were loved by all in my family and they were gone in no time! I didn't make the frosting and they were great.

These *are* the best brownies. I sometimes make them before a road trip, then place them in the fridge overnight before we go. The brownie part is soft and just the right consisency, and the icing is so good I use it for other recipes!
Good brownie - a little cakier than I'd like, but I only seem to find the dense, fudgy ones out of a box!
These were great! I have made them twice and they turned out perfect both times! I added a bit of milk to the frosting and it was perfect, spread just fine. All I can say is YUMMY!
Thank you - I brought these brownies to a potluck and they were a big hit!

These were some of the best brownies I have ever had. I doubled the recipe and used a bigger pan. I may bake them slightly longer next time, if I do it the same way. The frosting has a very nice flavor. Chocolate lovers beware!

Really Good Brownies! Making the frosting is too much time, energy and mess for me! Jut get a couple of Hershey Bars and break them up. Put them on top of the brownies right out of the oven. When they start to melt spread the chocolate around. WOW! When they are still warm and gooey they are great! When the chocolate re-sets --they are still to die for!!

These brownies turned out amazing. I made sure not to over cook them so they are very moist. I had to cook a little longer as I made a double batch but both my 9x13 pans were being used. I put 1/2 the batter in and then sprinkled with semi sweet chocolate chips. I then added the rest of the batter and sprinkled more on top. The top is crunchy but once you cut through the top the inside is so moist.
Ymmmmmmmmm! My family Loved them. Thank you soooo much for sharing this recipe.
OMG! the best brownies ever..can we say 'i cant believe i ate the whole thing' definitely a keeper.

These were really great brownies. I made a few changes: omitted the frosting, and replaced the vanilla extract with 1 tablespoon of Frangelico (hazelnut liqueur), also added 1/2 cup of chopped hazelnuts. Turned out really well!  PS: Or, try adding 1/2 cup walnuts and 1/2 cup Ghirardelli double chocolate chips to this recipe.. YUM.
Oh yeah, that's the stuff, baby! The icing is like heaven...I double it so there will be enough left for the brownies after all the sampling! Soooo goooood!
These brownies were AMAZING! I brought them to a dinner party and people were begging for the recipe. I skipped the frosting and added 1 cup of white chocolate chips to the batter. Delicious!

THESE ARE BY FAR-------THE BEST BROWNIES I HAVE EVER EATEN----------THEY ARE SO MOIST AND DELICIOUS-----I RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE LOOKING FOR A GREAT AND QUICK BROWNIE RECIPE-------MY KID'S LOVED THIS RECIPE!!!!!!!!!!!!
mmm good stuff! Easy, quick and moist. If you add 1 T of milk to the frosting it turns out :)
These brownies were VERY good & easy to make; even my brother liked them! The only down-side was you could taste too much honey in the frosting, so next time I'll use adifferent recipe for that.
these are my best and easiest-to-make brownies; comfort food for all times.
Everybody in my household including visitors admitted that these are the best brownies in the world. No need for frosting anymore. Yum yum already.
Good brownies but really really sweet.

The brownies turned out wonderful! They were easy to make and delicious. I did not attempt the frosting, due to some reviews said it wasn't very good. I used a Chocolate Fudge Buttercream and my kids love it!
Loved these brownies! Yum!
Extremely yummy! Soft and chewy, and wonderfully chocolately. I had a hard time with the frosting, next time I would just skip it.
These are the really THE BEST brownies! Even the when the batter's unbaked, it's still delicious. I add about 2 tablespoons (each) of ground up almonds and walnuts.
My family and I just loved these brownies! The frosting might have been too much but they were still a BIG hit!
These brownies are very good!! However, the icing was VERY thick and did not spread - even when the brownies were hot. Luckily, the brownies taste so good by themselves you don't need the icing.
Excellent; even better than Betty's!
This recipe was excellent! The brownies were so soft and moist, and the frosting was great. I added 1 cup of walnuts as well. When I baked it, I ate a quarter of the pan myself!
I make brownies often and this is one of the best recipes I've tried. Texture and flavor are good and it can't be much easier.

These were a hit with my family. Sometimes I just dust them with powdered sugar instead of making the icing. I have made the icing twice, and for some reason it comes out a little grainy. I can't figure out why, but it tastes good. C. Lindsay Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
It's great I loved it!!!!

These are terrific!!!! Icing is great,too- try it! ( Is the butter supposed to be melted for the icing? Mine was just a tad lumpy, but I heated it in the microwave for 15 seconds & stirred it & it was fine.) This is now my favorite brownie recipe.Thanks for sharing!!!
These brownies were good, but the frosting was really stiff, even with extra butter. I microwaved it for 60 seconds to get it to spreading consistancy. All in all, just average.
I found this brownie recipe to be very similar in flavor to Pillsbury brand brownie mix. It was moist and chewy.
These are yummy I took them to my work and they were gone quick

These brownies were good, but there are other recipes I've liked better-they were just kind of flat. Also, the frosting is completely unspreadable, especially on the warm soft brownies! Definately need to add milk to thin it out.
These brownies were wonderful!!! I haven't had luck in past homemade brownie recipes but these came out perfect and oh the chocolate!
This recipe really was excellent. I added a cup and a half of chocolate chips and omitted the frosting and my family loved them!
My family really liked these but I felt they needed baking a little longer & next time will do so.

WOW! This is the best Brownie I have ever made and eaten!! I have already made them three different times. Everyone tells me how wonderful they are...I have to agree! This is a keeper recipe!!( the frosting is a little thick..I thin it with milk or water)
A rare soy-free chocolate dessert. We make it regularly for birthday cakes.
Sweet and really choclately. The best
These are wonderful- very fudgy! I microwaved the frosting 30 seconds and added a little milk to make it spreadable.
This recipe is amazingly good! It tasted a little cakey at first but I left it overnight and it just got so fudgy!
Very yummy and buttery tasting! The frosting had a slight coconut flavor and I don't know why.

This is a great recipe. Almost as easy as a box, but twice the taste. I microwaved the icing for 30 seconds and had no trouble at all with it being stiff. Will definately use this again, but will double, they just went to fast.
Very yummy. LOVED the frosting. We gobbled them right up.

I was never a lover of brownies, but I choose this recipes for my company's party because it was so highly rated. I had a couple of bite of it and thought that it was okay, but everyone else... they never stop asking me for the recipe.
Wow- these were very good! The frosting was like a layer of fudge, very rich! I used 1 Tbsp of water in the frosting. A definate keeper.

These are by far the best brownies I've ever eaten, hands down! I didn't make the frosting, instead I tossed in some walnuts and chocolate chips. They came out moist, fudgy and absolutely fabulous! I've made these twice this weekend and already they're begging for more! Thank you for a wonderful recipe!!!!

This is the best brownies I have ever tasted. Crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. I did add some walnuts to the batter, and I found that the icing was a bit too stiff, so I substuted maple syrup for the honey and added 2 tbsp of cream.  Thankyou for such an awsome recipe
Bake them and let them set overnite!!! SUPERB!

I usually have a hard time finding recipes that will adapt to climate in different regions of the U.S. but this one one of the easiest most adaptable recipes I have ever tried. Thanks Angie for the recipe.

This recipe is unbelievably good . . . over winter break, my dad made me make it three or four times in one week. They never lasted more than a day. They're very rich, very indulgent, VERY chocolate-y, really good fresh out of the oven with some cold milk. Tip to everyone having a problem with the thick icing: put it on the brownies when they're still warm --- the icing will melt to a glaze texture, then reharden. Very easy. I'll never go back to the box.
These were very good brownies. They are slightly cakey but very moist. They are easy to make and have a good texture throughout.

Made these to take to work, and several people commented that they were by far the best brownies they'd ever had. The batter doesn't look as dark as a box mix, so I was worried I didn't add enough cocoa. It's much darker after it bakes, though, and very fudgy. I made a double batch in a 9x12 and baked 30 minutes.

What can i say but *Yum*?! All my flat think I'm a great baker now, especially when the American guy in our flat said these were great! I added pecans as I'm a big nut fan, I'd like to make orange ones next time, I can't wait!!

Growing up with my grandmother's brownies, loving to eat them, but not loving to make them, I was happily surprised by this deliciously quick, and easy recipe. The nicest part is that there is no clean up, and there is no way to mess this recipe up!!! go ahead indulge!!!!!!!!!

I made this a bit lower in fat without losing any taste by decreasing the margarine to 1/4 cup, and adding in a small jar of baby food prunes. The brownies were gone in a flash. Try it, you will be surprised.
these were the best brownies I have ever had...I didn't even get to the frosting...my husband ate half the pan as soon as they came out! Forget boxes, this is our new favorite!! Many many stars....

Superb recipe! I've been trying out numerous brownie recipe, this is the best so far. My boyfriend is a chocoholic and is always complaining that my brownies aren't chocolaty enough, but with this one, he has no complaints. The frosting is a little too thick though, so i just thinned it out with a bit of milk. A must try.. YUMMY!!
These are the 'Best Brownies' ever! No need to buy a mix again or use any other recipe.
I've made these brownies twice and they are delicious and very easy to make.
I love this recipe. I've made these the last three days, and everyone wants more. the frosting is the best. Thank you Angie, these are so quick and good, it's unreal
Simple and divine!
This recipe is fabulous!! It was simple to make, turned out perfectly, and tasted absolutely delicioius!!

After reading so many wonderful reviews, I had to try these. These are soooooooo good. I did have to add a bit of milk to the frosting to thin it out, but that's all I had to change. I think we ate the whole pan in 2 days. And these are definitely better the first day. But you can warm them up in the microwave and add a scoop of vanilla ice cream - heavenly! Thanks for a delicious recipe that I'll be making again and again!
These are great brownies! Quick and easy. I added some nuts and a few chocolate chips and made them even better!!

Wow! what can i say! these were so good! YUM! im sixteen and made these for my family, they loved them! i think without the flour, it would be a great fudge recipe. but great as a brownie! i didnt need the icing!

Simple and excellent. I don't unerstand how anyone could screw this up!! I made a double batch, one for my neighbor, and one for my husband. I only used about half of the icing, so next time I will adjust for an 9x13' pan using icing for an 8x10. I will be making these again. Thanks Angie

I really liked the texture of these brownies. They weren't too gooey, or too cakey, or too fudgy. Pretty much they were the perfect combination of those qualities. I thought they were better than box mix also. Those usually have a chemical aftertaste. Also I usually have to chisel/ice pick the edges of any brownies I've ever made before. This was the first time for me that the edges were just as edible as the middle. That was a new & enjoyable experience! :o) Another reviewer mentioned the superiority of Hersheys cocoa powder over Nestles. I myself used Nestles (it's all I had) and I don't think Nestles is evil at all! :) In fact, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend using this recipe, Nestles & all! Go 'head! [note: I omitted the frosting because I didn't have any confectioners sugar on hand. I don't think I will even bother with the frosting anyways!]

(me being a bowl licker and all)In the begining I didn't exactly like the flavor of the batter, but after they were cooked I loved them! They were so moist and delicious that I decided to not even make the frosting!
We enjoyed this without the frosting and sprinkled powdered sugar on top for a pretty presentation. Very good, very easy! It's a keeper!
this is the best brownies i've ever make!!!! it's soooo delicious.. the best thing about this brownies is that they're chewy and fudgy...
The best I've ever made, why look any futher. I've passed this one down to all my friends. Thanks

We have this fun raising things in school(mostly for every occassion). I am always incharge, usually I make this brownies out of the recipe that my teacher gave me, but it's lost. I was browsing through the net and found this recipe. The great thing was that it turns out to be really good, PERFECTO!! My friends enjoy it, and every month they demand a box filled with brownies!

One you make these you'll need more...we couldn't keep out 'mitts' off of them. Even my husband (Mr. Boxed Brownies) loved them. This is a recipe you'll have for a on tim--print it off, you'll need it.
They turned out really well. A little sweet for my taste, but still very good. I had to bake mine a little longer, very old oven. Great recipe!
it was kinda quick and easy
they really do turn out- and incredibly sweet and chocolaty without having to use chocolate at all.
Left the honey out of icing. Icing got pretty stiff before I could spread it, but was still tasty!

These brownies were very good, however, the frosting was too sweet for my taste. I usually buuuy the brownie in a box, but it's nice to know how to make them from scratch, esp. since they are so easy.
At first I was skeptical about strictly coco brownies but these were MARVELOUS!!!!! Everyone at the office raved! Perfect for fast- already in your pantry chocolate fix. 5 stars!
The frosting was very difficult to spread, but other than that the brownies were pretty good.

I have to agree with everyone else - these are the best brownies I've ever made! I too, doubled the recipe and used Hershey's Dutched Processed cocoa. After 25 minutes in the oven, the brownies came out fudgy and delicious! I added a 'splash' of milk to the frosting and it came out smooth and creamy. I don't know if this made a difference, but after spreading the frosting on the brownies (while they were warm), I then covered them and put them in the refrigerator for a couple hours. To say they got 'rave reviews' is an understatement - I think there was even some 'jealousy' involved!! ;) Thanks for ending my brownie search!
My husband and son love it. :)
Doubled the batch and used 9X13 pan and added only 5 more minutes to baking time. Moist, sweet and chocolatey even without topping. DO NOT OVERCOOK. Very easy and so much better than the box.
They were good, but the frosting didn't spread. I don't know if I did something wrong or not. Other than that they were pretty good. They also stuck in the pan.
Sooo tasty, the best brownies I've ever made!

My family and I were not impressed with these brownies. I threw away half of them. They tasted like a box brownie mix, not at all as good as my usual homemade brownies. Although, they were easy and use ingredients that most people have on hand. They are okay if you are in a hurry.

These brownies weren't the 'best' as its title proudly proclaims but they were good. Slightly on the rich side, though. These are nice, basic brownies if you don't want to fool around and just want brownies.

These are the BEST brownies! Nice and gooey! Anyone who says these are not moist enough or that they are too cakey, have definately over-cooked them. Great once cooled, but much, much better the next day. Thanks!
Everyone at work loved them!

I made these without the frosting, as I didnt have some of the ingredients for it on hand, but that didnt matter. These brownies were fantastic alone. I think next time I may mix some orange zest into the batter to give it a wee bit of original flavor. Great recipe!

These were great -- I baked them by spreading half the batter in the pan, and then spreading a thin layer of raspberry jam on top, and then pouring on the rest of the batter -- it turned out wonderfully!
All of the ease of a box mix but with a better taste. Definitely better the next day!

This was my first'not from a box' brownies. They tuned out perfect.(to my surprise)I topped them with a cream cheese frosting. THat may have made them too rich. They are soooooo sweet. Get a gallon of whole milk and sit back because you can't eat just one.
Good taste, not as moist as I would have liked, but overall good. Very quick to  make.
It's too sweet and too cakey for my taste.
Double the recipe, add chopped walnuts (about a cup)! Also, sprinkle chopped walnuts on the icing before it dries. Excellent recipe!
Way glad to of found this recipe, batter then any store bought I have ever tasted, my family cleaned them up so fast I had to hurry and get some, Thanks Jerry
I have made loads of brownies before, but these are by far the best. I did wait the day and it was worth it. They disappeared so quickly that I only had two. I guess it's time to make another batch!
These were the most scrumptious brownies! Definately worth the day wait. Yummy!

Wow! I just wanted to make a treat real quick, but didn't have much on hand. These were perfect! I have never had brownies turn out as good as these did. I did them w/o the frosting, but a lot of people said to wait a day to eat them...I just couldnt wait! I waited a few hours, and they were still just a delicious!! :)
All I can say is: ...mmm...mmm...Good! These brownies are the best, just like th recipe says! They are quick and easy to fix and oh-so-good!

Excellent brownies! I did follow everyone's advice and waited a day after baking them. They were absolutely delicious!! No need to look for another recipe. This is the one! I made them with the frosting which I thought would be too sweet, but excellent!

Yesterday afternoon, I think I read every brownie recipe this site has. I read all the reviews too. It took me so long to decide which one to make that by the time they were made and out of the oven, we were having dessert that was still warm. I've never had brownies so good. I didn't make the frosting/topping. I threw in a handful of chocolate chips when I was mixing them. OMG, they were soooo good. I served them warm with ice cream and chocolate sauce drizzled over them. I put it in 8x8 pan and there's...lemme see....none left. Ha!
Everyone who tried these said they were WAY to sweet. Well, everyone except my brother. He LOVED them! Different strokes for different folks...
easy to prepare and they taste great!!
One of the easiest to make and clean up I have ever made. They taste wonderful and this will become a family favorite.

These tasted really good. They were a little harder to make because I had to double the recipe. (I needed to make treats for a group of people.) It also took a little while longer than I'd thought to cook them. Be careful not to cook them too long.

These are the best brownies so far. A little dry, I am going to try it with brown sugar next time. Also I had to add a few drops of water to the icing. Make sure to ice when the brownies are still hot. The family ate them all up in one evening. I will definately make them again.

These brownies were a hit at my husbands job and with my son. I did leave out the frosting though, personally I think that frosting on brownies are best when you have a crowd of PMSing females. :) I will be making these again and again. Thanks Angie!!
wonderfully chewy and fudgy, however i found these to be a bit sweet. next time i plan on reducing the sugar to 3/4 cup. i added chocolate chips and they turned out great!
A really easy, pleasing brownie. The pan disappears very quickly at our home! Irene J.

I made these as part of my Chirsmas cookie batch and received soooo many compliments. The icing was a liittle tricky though. The icing truly needs to be thinned out so that you don't take of the top of the brownie as you spread it on top.

Not bad. Certainly not fudgy, but they are chewy. The frosting was terribly cloying, though. I might make them again, although they don't satisfy the desire for a sinfully rich and fudgy brownie.  Addendum: Well, I ate some more of these this morning, the day after they had been made and they were SO MUCH BETTER! The icing didn't taste overly sweet and it had kind of melded with the brownies. Quite tasty! Also, the honey flavor in the frosting (which I hadn't really cared for) disappeared.
These turned out very well. I opted to skip the frosting. These contain a lot of sugar but I received many compliments on them!
great recipe, but didn't need the frosting.
i Don't know if kids love it but whenever i make a batch, my husband devours them! Adding nuts makes them even better!
really good with butterscotch chips!
This is the BEST and easiest brownie recipe! They taste absolutely wonderful!
all time best brownies I ever made, just make sure to ice when hot
Boy was I disappointed! These are good brownies, but certainly not 'the best' that I've ever had. My fiancee wouldn't even go near them!!
a little dry
The brownies were wonderful and are the best I have had in some time, but the frosting was not to my taste so I left it off.

This recipe is good, but there are so many similar brownie recipes that are just as easy and tasty. When reading the reviews, I thought that this was going to be something out of this world. I have found that any brownie recipe that is put together on top of the stove all in one pot always comes out this way.

This is a fantastic recipe. Very easy. I added about 1/4 c of chopped walnuts cause to me it isn't a brownie without nuts. The icing was just a bit thick so I added a tsp. of water to it. The pan was gone in half a day!
We like this one. We baked them in mini muffin tins and that makes them great for lunches. Thanks
They were really easy to make and the recipe was easy to follow, however they were a cake-ish for my taste. I prefer a chewier brownie.
I had made these brownies for my boyfriend and roommate and his girlfriend. Everyone who had tried them had stated that they were top notch. I am not even a chocolate lover but I really enjoyed them.
awesome recipe! I cut the recipe in half for a small serving, and still came out!
These are truly the best brownies I have ever tasted. They are also quick to make. I didn't used frosting, I just sifted icing sugar over them. Yum!!
So chewy! So good! EXCELLENT!

I was skeptical at first about the rave reviews but these really are awesome! I'm not much of a frosting person so I just sprinkled powered sugar on top and they were so delicious. So much for my diet.
